name: Waffles
directions: In a large bowl, mix egg yolks, margarine, and sugar with a large wooden spoon
Add flour, baking soda, salt, and milk; mix until combined
In a separate bowl, beat egg whites until stiff peaks form
Gently fold the beaten egg whites into the primary mixture
Mix gently until just combined
Cook waffles according to your waffle iron’s instructions until golden brown

name: Snickerdoodles
directions: Preheat the oven to 400°F
In a large bowl, mix 1 1/2 cups sugar, margarine, shortening, and eggs until well blended
Stir in flour, cream of tartar, baking soda, and salt
Shape dough into balls using rounded tablespoons
In a small bowl, mix 3 tbsp sugar and cinnamon. Roll each dough ball in the cinnamon-sugar mixture
Place balls about 2 inches apart on an ungreased cookie sheet
Bake 8 to 10 minutes, or until set
Immediately remove from cookie sheet and cool completely on a wire rack

name: Mud Cake
directions: Preheat the oven to 350°F
In a large bowl, mix flour, brown sugar, sugar, cocoa, baking soda, baking powder, and salt with a fork
Add eggs, oil, water with coffee, and sour cream. Mix until combined
Pour the mixture into a 9 x 13-inch pan
Bake for 45 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center of the cake comes out clean

name: Chocolate Chip Muffins
directions: Preheat the oven to 350°F
In a first bowl, sift together the flour, baking powder, and salt
In a second bowl, combine the sour cream and baking soda
In a third bowl, beat the butter and sugar until light and fluffy
Add the eggs and vanilla extract to the butter mixture and beat until combined
Gradually mix in the dry ingredients and the sour cream mixture, beginning and ending with the dry ingredients
Fold in the chocolate chips with a large wooden spoon
Pour batter into muffin tins and bake. 20 minutes for mini muffins. 25–30 minutes for regular muffins
Allow to cool slightly before serving

name: Banana Bread
directions: Preheat oven to 325°F
Grease a loaf pan (9 × 5 × 3 inches or 8 1/2 × 4 1/2 × 2 1/2 inches) with shortening
In a large bowl, mix sugar, bananas, oil, and eggs with a wooden spoon
Stir in remaining ingredients and pour batter into prepared pan
Bake until a wooden toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean, about 60–70 minutes
Let cool for 10 minutes, then loosen sides of loaf from pan and remove
Let cool completely before slicing

name: Peanut Blossom Cookies
ingredients: 1 (14-ounce) can sweetened condensed milk (not evaporated milk)
Approximately 60 milk chocolate kisses (one per cookie)
directions: Preheat the oven to 350°F
In a mixing bowl, beat sweetened condensed milk, peanut butter, egg, and vanilla until smooth
Add the biscuit mix and mix well
Chill the dough for at least one hour
Shape the dough into 1-inch balls
Roll each ball in sugar
Place cookies about 2 inches apart on an ungreased cookie sheet
Bake for 10–12 minutes or until lightly browned
Immediately after baking, press a chocolate kiss into the center of each cookie
Let cool and store tightly covered at room temperature

name: Chocolate Chip Cookies
directions: Preheat the oven to 375°F
In a large bowl, mix granulated sugar, brown sugar, margarine or butter, and egg with a wooden spoon
Stir in flour, baking soda, and salt (dough will be stiff). Stir in chocolate chips
Drop rounded dough (about 1 tablespoon) 3 inches apart onto an ungreased cookie sheet
Bake until light brown, about 8 to 10 minutes (centers will be soft)
Let cookies cool slightly, then remove from the cookie sheet with a spatula

name: Peanut Butter Cookies
directions: Preheat oven to 375°F
In a large bowl, combine peanut butter, shortening, brown sugar, milk, and vanilla; beat until well blended
Add egg and beat just until blended
In a separate bowl, combine flour, salt, and baking soda
Add the flour mixture to the creamed mixture; mix just until blended
Drop dough (about 1 tbsp) two inches apart onto an ungreased cookie sheet
Flatten slightly in a crisscross pattern with a fork
Bake 7 to 8 minutes, or until beginning to brown
Let cool 2 minutes on the baking sheet, then transfer cookies to a wire rack to cool completely

name: Peanut Butter Cup Muffin-cookies
ingredients: 2 packages mini Reese's peanut butter cups
directions: Preheat oven to 375°F
In a large bowl, combine peanut butter, shortening, brown sugar, milk, and vanilla; beat until well blended
Add egg and beat just until blended
In a separate bowl, combine flour, salt, and baking soda
Gradually add the dry ingredients to the creamed mixture; mix just until blended
Drop dough (about 1 tablespoon each) into an ungreased mini muffin pan
Bake 7–8 minutes, or until edges begin to brown
Immediately press an unwrapped mini peanut butter cup into the center of each cookie
Remove from pan and let cool completely

name: Texas Sheet Cake
directions: Preheat the oven to 350°F
Spray a 10 1/2 x 15 1/2-inch pan with nonstick cooking spray
Combine flour and sugar in a small bowl; set aside
In a medium saucepan, heat water, vegetable oil, and cocoa powder over medium heat; bring to a boil, stirring occasionally. Using a whisk, stir in the flour mixture
Add eggs, buttermilk, baking soda, vanilla, and salt; mix well. Pour into prepared pan
Bake 22–25 minutes or until a wooden toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean
Cool 10 minutes before frosting
In a large microwave-safe bowl, combine milk, cocoa powder, and vegetable oil. Microwave on HIGH for 45 seconds or until oil is melted; whisk until smooth
Add powdered sugar and vanilla; whisk until smooth
Spread frosting over warm cake using a large scraper
Let cool completely. Cut into squares. Store in a tightly covered container in the refrigerator

name: Crispix Mix Sweet Minglers
ingredients: 1 package (6 oz or 1 cup) semisweet chocolate chips
directions: In a large microwave-safe bowl, melt chocolate at HIGH for 1 minute. Stir and heat an additional 30 seconds at HIGH, or until melted. Stir in peanut butter. Gently stir Kellogg’s Crispix cereal into the chocolate–peanut butter mixture until well coated
Place powdered sugar in a 2-gallon storage container. Add coated cereal, close the container, and gently toss until well coated

name: Fudge Brownies
directions: Preheat the oven to 350°F
Grease the bottom only of an 8x8x2-inch square pan with shortening
In a 2-quart saucepan over low heat, melt the margarine and 1 cup semisweet chocolate chips, stirring constantly. Remove from heat
Stir in the sugar, flour, vanilla extract, baking powder, and eggs with a wooden spoon until smooth
Fold in the nuts and remaining 1/2 cup semisweet chocolate chips, if desired
Spread the batter evenly in the prepared pan using a rubber scraper
Bake for approximately 30 minutes, until the center is set
Let brownies cool completely, then cut into squares. Store tightly covered

name: O'Henry Bites
directions: Melt brown sugar, corn syrup, and peanut butter in a saucepan over low heat (do not boil)
Remove from heat and stir in Rice Krispies and peanuts
Mix all ingredients thoroughly
Shape mixture into small balls
Dip the balls in slowly melted milk chocolate (use the 'defrost' mode if using a microwave)
Place chocolate-coated balls in the freezer for approximately 5 minutes to set
